results.title: Index to progress
results.creator_credit: Walter F. Broome and Beechdale Educational Films
results.brief_description: A survey of urban and rural library services in Great Britain. Shows the following various types of libraries and the services provided by each: Reference, Commercial, Technical and Children’s libraries and the local collection.

results.title: Independence Day USA
results.creator_credit: John G. Fuller and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Describes the various ways in which individual Americans celebrate their Independence Day, July 4th. They honour the heroes responsible for the Declaration of Independence and the national ideals of human rights embodied in it.

results.title: Incredible Floridas
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Incredible Floridas is composer Richard Meale’s homage to the French poet, Arthur Rimbaud. Scored for woodwind, percussion and string instruments, it was written for the “Fires of London” and their conductor, Peter Maxwell Davies, and premiered in London in 1971 to a enthusiastic reception. Richard Meale is a leader in contemporary music in Australia. Also available on DVD [319174].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Weir, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Increasing productivity and efficiency: setting the right climate
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Delves into teamwork, what it is and is not, how to institute it, the climate in which it flourishes. Portrays a five-point model for critiquing progress and discusses the line manager’s vital role as a paraprofessional trainer.

results.title: Incontinence: a diarrhetic flow of obvious mismatches
results.creator_credit: Manuel De Landa and De Landa
results.brief_description: Experimental film dealing with film editing and the visual image. Contains seven individual sequences of mismatching dialogue/actors/scenes with all scenes based on actual dialogue from “Who’s afraid of Virginia Woolf?”. However, a comic nightmare takes place and a healthy disregard for the text creates quite a bizarre interpretation of this well-known piece of literature. Cast includes Dina Paisner, Ken Burns, Patrick Gerstle, Susan Schneider and others.

results.title: Including me. Parts I and II
results.creator_credit: Linda Janower and Indiana University. Audio Visual Center
results.brief_description: Part I documents some of the problems encountered by handicapped individuals and explains how recent Federal legislation can help them find school programs appropriate to their needs. Part II focuses on four handicapped individuals who have succeeded in making progress in educational settings.

results.title: Inclined planes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Presents the principle of the inclined plane, including the screw and wedge. Shows how an inclined plane or slope facilitates the moving of heavy objects. Demonstrates the everyday use of the inclined plane and explains that such simple machines as screws and wedges are used when it is desirable to trade distance for force.

results.title: Incident at Hawk's Hill
results.brief_description: A story based on Allan W. Eckert’s novel “Incident at Hawk’s Hill” about a shy, lonely six-year-old who wanders into the Canadian Prairie and spends a summer under the protection of a badger. Edited from the motion picture entitled “The Boy who talked to badgers”, originally shown in 1974 on the teelevision program “The Wonderful World of Disney”.
